intro: Allosampela heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from linear to ovate, depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Allosampela heterophylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
